main event: A U.S. servicemember observed a highly polished, silver, circular object traveling at a high speed over a golf course in Japan.
interesting points: The object was approximately 2.5 feet long and 1 foot wide, and appeared to be made of a highly polished, silver-like material.
The object was traveling at an estimated speed of 120 mph and an altitude of 1,000 feet, parallel to the ground.
The object suddenly rose vertically to 3,000 feet before changing direction and disappearing.
There was no evidence of smoke or exhaust, and no sound could be detected due to the object's high speed.
The observer reported the object to higher command and provided sketches of the object's shape and maneuvers.
sighted object: a highly polished, silver, circular object
